Snapshot: Clear site agreements prevent misunderstandings and secure long-term placements; outline access, liability, hive numbers, and expectations.
Supply & Demand: Good sites near key flows are scarce; professional communication and tidy yards create demand for your presence rather than tolerance.
Revenue Streams: Some landowners accept rent in honey, others prefer cash; formalise barter values and delivery schedules. Add clauses for crop pollination or publicity where useful.
Risks & Compliance: Define pesticide notifications, water provision, fencing, signage, and indemnity. Keep public liability current and provide evidence on request.
Further Reading & Sources: Use association template MOUs and adapt to local legal norms; document with site maps and photo records.
